gr.fire.util
Class FireConnector

java.lang.Object
  gr.fire.util.FireConnector

public class FireConnector
extends java.lang.Object

FireConnector is a utility class containing a set of I/O supporting methods. This implementation is a wrapper for Connector and also an easy way to access the RecordStore. All methods starting with "rms" have RecordStore related functionality.

Author:
padeler

rmsSize

public int[] rmsSize(java.lang.String name)
Returns an int[2] where the first value is the size of the record store and the second is the size available.

Parameters:
name - the name of the record store to check for.
Returns:
if the record store exists returns an int[2] with the size/free. If it does not returns {0,0}

rmsWrite

public int rmsWrite(java.lang.String file,
                    java.io.InputStream in,
                    int len)
             throws javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreFullException,
                    javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException,
                    java.io.IOException
Creates a new recordstore or ovewrites an old one with the same name and saves up to len bytes from the inputstream.

Parameters:
file - The name of the record store
in - The InputStream from where to read bytes
len - The maximum number of bytes that will be written to the record store.
Returns:
The number of bytes that where written to the record store
Throws:
javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreFullException
javax.microedition.rms.RecordStoreException
java.io.IOException

openInputStream

public java.io.InputStream openInputStream(java.lang.String url)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                           javax.microedition.io.ConnectionNotFoundException,
                                           java.io.IOException,
                                           java.lang.SecurityException
If the given URL starts with "file://" this method open a stream to the local file (inside the jar) or if that does not exist it will try to find a recordstore with the same name (without the "file:/" prefix). Note that the name of the recordstore searched will start with a "/". If it does not start with "file://" it will use Connector.openInputStream(url) to try and return an InputStream to the url using the platform's capabilities.

Parameters:
url -
Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
javax.microedition.io.ConnectionNotFoundException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.SecurityException

rmsExists

public boolean rmsExists(java.lang.String f)
Checks if a recordstore exists.

Parameters:
f - name of the record store
Returns:
true if record store exists

rmsReadUTF

public java.lang.String rmsReadUTF(java.lang.String f)
                            throws java.io.IOException
Reads a recordstore and returns a utf string from it. The record store must have been writen with the writeUTF method.

Parameters:
f - the name of the record store
Returns:
null if the record store does not exist or a String with its contents otherwise.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If an exception is thrown while reading the record store.
